English: In the morning, Lamentin
In the UAZ
Well done, Rashiv. Comrade major Lemontov had only good things to say about you.\nYou're making our squad proud, comrade!
I knew you had it in you. Now, get in the UAZ, we need to get back to Le Moule.
It's not everyday one receives a request from spetsnaz. And it's not everyday that we fulfill that request and get a commendation.\nAnd from comrade Lemontov at that!
If that man says you've got potential, then you can be sure as hell you have great potential.\nIt runs in your family, eh Rashiv?
Still not much of a talker, I see. But that is good. Talking too much is not desirable.
Capturing Lamentin gave us Le Moule without a fight and opened up a way to Montignac.\nThere will be an offensive soon, Rashiv, one final push to drive the enemy out of here.
You are smart even if you do not show it. I know the thoughts in your head. I have those throughs too.
You're not sure what are really doing here. Where are the locals we are supposed to be helping? I can see the questions in your eyes."
But have no fear. Put your faith in Mother Russia and our command. They shall lead us to final victory.
Hah, I say do not talk much and look at me. But we're finally here.
You call this a camp? My grandmother would have made better! Take it down and start anew!
Interesting that whenever shit hits the fan, they call for us. As if we are the only squad available...
Exactly! They even borrow soldiers from us, right Sergey?
While we're at it, be glad they didn't assign us to the attack on Levie, comrades.
Levie was a fucking massacre, I heard. I had a friend who was a medic there.\nHe said he hasn't seen that much blood in a long time... Parts of limbs, internal organs splattered on the ground...
Stop that you idiot! I am sick already from the car, your bullshit does not help.
Being on the same squad does not mean I won't kick the shit out of you...
Enough, comrades! You are especially unruly today!\nStop pissing me off! We'll be there shortly.

BAZA TO ANTON, WE LOST CONTACT WITH PATROL BORIS. THEIR LAST KNOWN POSITION IS AROUND THE FORESTS AT DA47. TRANSPORT WILL PICK YOU UP. TAKE A LOOK AROUND AND SEE IF YOU CAN FIND THEM. HOPEFULLY IT'S JUST A MALFUNCTIONING RADIO. OVER.
ANTON TO BAZA, UNDERSTOOD, WE ARE ON OUR WAY. OUT.
THERE'S THEIR TRUCK OVER THERE. IT'S BURNING. YOU SHOULD HEAD OUT FROM HERE.
SPREAD OUT! LOOK FOR SURVIVORS!
ANTON TO BAZA, WE'RE ENGAGING THE ENEMY AT THE LAST KNOWN LOCATION OF PATROL BORIS. OUT.
THE TRAIL LEADS FURTHER UP THE ROAD. WE ARE GOING TO FOLLOW IT.
ANOTHER FIRE IN THE DISTANCE! WE SHOULD INVESTIGATE.
ANTON TO BORIS, WE SEE YOU! HOLD ON!
HEADS UP, MEN, REINFORCEMENTS ARE HERE!
THANKS FOR YOUR HELP, THAT WAS CLOSE, ANTON. WE WOULD LIKE TO GET OUT OF HERE NOW, IF YOU DO NOT MIND!
SHIT, WE'VE COME TOO LATE. WE HAVE TO GET OUT OF HERE!
GET THE TRANSPORT HERE, BEFORE MORE ENEMIES ARRIVE.
BAZA TO ANTON, CLEAN WORK, GUYS. WELL DONE. BAZA OUT.
BAZA TO ANTON, IT IS UNFORTUNATE ABOUT BORIS. RETURN TO THE BASE FOR DEBRIEFING. BAZA OUT.
Forest
Squad
FOREST
LE MOULE
